channel.title: Summary and Strategies :: CIS 301 Textbook
channel.description: In this section, we summarize all available rules in propositional logic, and discuss strategies for approaching proofs. Rules with universal quantifier (∀) Rule summaries: ∀ ((x: T) => P(x)) AllE[T]: --------------------- P(v) where v is a particular individual in the domain (i.e, v has type T) Let ( (a: T) => SubProof( ... P(a) )), AllI[T] : ------------------------------- ∀ ((x: T) => P(x)) Rule syntax summaries:
